intro: [WRONG START] Bupleurum triradatum var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf Chinese angelica, is a perennial herb native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various health purposes.
